name: Hakeem Jeffries
title: House Democratic Leader
lastAction: Called Fine 'an Islamophobic, disgusting and unrepentant bigot' and 'a disgrace to the United States Congress'; demanded Speaker Johnson take action

name: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
title: U.S. Representative (NY-14)
lastAction: Called Fine's post 'genuinely one of the most disgusting statements I have ever seen issued by an American official'; called for censure and committee removal

name: Dan Goldman
title: U.S. Representative (NY-10)
lastAction: Called Fine's remarks 'an unacceptable and revolting Islamophobic comment' that is 'incredibly damaging to Jews trying to combat antisemitism'; urged Speaker Johnson to bring censure vote and strip committee assignments

name: Katherine Clark
title: House Democratic Whip
lastAction: Co-signed joint Democratic leadership statement calling Fine's comments 'unhinged, racist and Islamophobic' and 'bigoted and disgusting'; highlighted Republican leaders' silence on MSNBC

name: Pete Aguilar
title: House Democratic Caucus Chair
lastAction: Co-signed joint Democratic leadership statement calling Fine's comments 'unhinged, racist and Islamophobic' and 'bigoted and disgusting', though stopped short of calling for formal censure vote

name: Yassamin Ansari
title: U.S. Representative (AZ-3)
lastAction: Called Fine's remarks 'one of the most disgusting statements' by an official; demanded Speaker Johnson reprimand him immediately; noted Fine has 'repeatedly dehumanized Muslims without consequence'

name: Delia Ramirez
title: U.S. Representative (IL-3)
lastAction: Called Fine's post 'despicable, hateful and dangerous' and demanded he resign from Congress

name: Ro Khanna
title: U.S. Representative (CA-17)
lastAction: Called for Fine's censure, writing 'We must call this what it is. Disgusting bigotry.'

name: Ritchie Torres
title: U.S. Representative (NY-15)
lastAction: Signaled support for forced censure vote against Fine

name: Ayanna Pressley
title: U.S. Representative (MA-7)
lastAction: Signaled support for forced censure vote against Fine

name: Pat Ryan
title: U.S. Representative (NY-18)
lastAction: Signaled support for forced censure vote against Fine

name: Robert Garcia
title: U.S. Representative (CA-42)
lastAction: Called Fine's post 'disgusting Islamophobia and dangerous bigotry' and said 'he should be forced to resign'

name: Gavin Newsom
title: Governor of California
lastAction: Publicly told Fine on X to 'Resign now, you racist slob'

name: Megyn Kelly
title: Media commentator and journalist
lastAction: Called Fine a 'pathetic sweaty man' who 'went full bigot' instead of criticizing the policy, on her show and social media

name: Mike Chitwood
title: Volusia County Sheriff
lastAction: Rescinded his endorsement of Fine, citing inability to support wishing for children in Gaza to starve or expelling Muslim American citizens

name: Don Bacon
title: U.S. Representative (NE-2)
lastAction: Only elected Republican in Congress to publicly disagree, saying 'I appreciate Randy Fine for many things, but I don't agree with this. We should be respectful to others.'

name: Charles Gambaro
title: Palm Coast City Council Member; GOP primary challenger to Fine (FL-6)
lastAction: Said Fine 'wears his bigotry like a badge of honor' and is 'an unhinged public official that has absolutely no business serving in Congress'

name: Ron DeSantis
title: Governor of Florida
lastAction: Has not condemned Fine's anti-Muslim rhetoric despite being Florida's governor; previously called Fine 'a squish' and said 'he repels people' but only over political disagreements, not bigotry

name: Mike Johnson
title: Speaker of the House
lastAction: Has refused to comment on or take any action against Fine's anti-Muslim rhetoric despite repeated calls from Democrats and civil rights organizations to bring a censure vote or strip committee assignments

name: Chip Roy
title: U.S. Representative (TX-21); Co-chair, Sharia Free America Caucus
lastAction: Posted 'I stand with Rep. Fine -- and will fight any move to censure him'; co-founded the Sharia Free America Caucus with Fine; cosponsored Fine's 'Protecting Puppies from Sharia Act'

name: Mark Harris
title: U.S. Representative (NC-8)
lastAction: Praised Fine's 'courage' on Newsmax, said his post was 'on the spot', called censure efforts 'ridiculous', and cosponsored Fine's troll bill

name: Keith Self
title: U.S. Representative (TX-3); Co-chair, Sharia Free America Caucus
lastAction: Co-founded Sharia Free America Caucus; cosponsored Fine's 'Protecting Puppies from Sharia Act' as a provocative response to backlash

name: Brandon Gill
title: U.S. Representative (TX-26)
lastAction: Cosponsored Fine's 'Protecting Puppies from Sharia Act' bill, doubling down on Fine's anti-Muslim framing

name: Mary Miller
title: U.S. Representative (IL-15)
lastAction: Cosponsored Fine's 'Protecting Puppies from Sharia Act' bill, signaling support for his anti-Muslim rhetoric

name: Andy Harris
title: U.S. Representative (MD-1); Chair, House Freedom Caucus
lastAction: Cosponsored Fine's 'Protecting Puppies from Sharia Act' as House Freedom Caucus Chairman
